alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 11:13AM EDT until August 01 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg affecting Floyd County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Levisa Fork at Prestonsburg. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 22.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 31.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 22.6 feet Saturday morning. It will rise to 24.3 feet early Sunday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. The next statement will be issued 4 PM EDT.
